intro: Canthium salubenii, commonly known as the African spurred tortoise plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various soil types. Canthium salubenii is also valued for its potential medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
